DOC.brief_title: Amino Acid Acylcarnitine Profiles Premature Neonates
DOC.detailed_description: Malnutrition common problem neonatal intensive care unit . Recent study indicate prematurely bear neonate commonly develop severe nutritional deficit first week birth , refer extrauterine growth restriction . Despite increase growth second month hospitalization , many neonate ultimately discharge home grown inadequately . The early nutritional deficit affect weight gain well growth length head circumference . Aggressive administration parenteral amino acid improve protein accretion rate preterm neonate support literature . Although tolerance high dose amino acid describe , researcher acknowledge sensitive test monitor amino acid toxicity readily available clinical setting . The goal study : - To good define normal amino acid acylcarnitine value change premature neonates - To measure effect nutritional support ( human breastmilk vs. formula ) amino acid acylcarnitines profile - To measure effect illness ( parenteral nutrition associate cholestasis ) amino acid acylcarnitine profile - To good define abnormal metabolic profile ( low tyrosine level ) neonates hypothyroidism .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Documentation inform consent Inborn Less equal twenty four ( 24 ) hour age Gestational age twenty three ( 23 ) week 0/7 day thirty one ( 31 ) week 0/7 day per best estimate neonatologist If subject transfer another hospital , ability obtain followup data outcomes No known major anomaly ( inborn error metabolism , chromosomal abnormality , cyanotic congenital heart disease , gastroschisis , omphalocele , diaphragmatic hernia major gastrointestinal anomaly , major neurological injury anomaly , multiple congenital anomaly ) Exclusion Criteria Outborn ( transfer intensive care another hospital ) Greater twenty four ( 24 ) hour age Gestational age < 23 week > 31 week Any known major congenital anomaly
